{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3185808,"name":"Martin Pirringer","username":"mpirringer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mpirringer/{size}/124489_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T23:07:45.599Z","cooked":"

Recently I was asked a couple of times how I test and what I use (battery etc)

So I share. I built myself a little setup using a 60 Amp 12V PSU that I stuck into a case to cover the “nasty stuff”

So here is one of the PSU I am using (you can get them on aliexpress up to 1500 watts I think
https://www.aliexpress.us/item/3256802376570807.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.205.21ef1802MXaaep&gatewayAdapt=glo2usa&_randl_shipto=US
Then I use a plug with a fuse on the AC side
https://www.aliexpress.us/item/2251832628953093.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.506.21ef1802MXaaep&gatewayAdapt=glo2usa4itemAdapt&_randl_shipto=US
Then I put a Fuse on the DC side - I got a lot of those
https://www.aliexpress.us/item/2255801109017430.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.517.21ef1802MXaaep&gatewayAdapt=glo2usa4itemAdapt&_randl_shipto=US
And I put an ammeter in
https://www.aliexpress.us/item/3256801648000299.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.222.21ef1802MXaaep&gatewayAdapt=glo2usa&_randl_shipto=US
Here are some pics

20220620_1641211920×3409 359 KB

20220621_1337351920×3409 485 KB

20220621_1337381920×3409 478 KB

20220622_1517161920×3409 411 KB

And a video of testing some gears
20220618_1154301920×1081 82.2 KB

Now you can run that forever (if properly cooling the motors) This particular gearbox gears up and back down and I can stick a CIM at the output with the wires shorted - so in “break” mode and read the load on the Ammeter and calculate the tooth load at each stage and run it long enough to simulate a robot season and see if something wears or breaks etc.
Of course sometimes you need a motor controller in between and I usually use an arduino to control that one
